intro: Phacelia vallicola, commonly known as the valley phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It thrives in full sun and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Phacelia vallicola plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
